7725151_syn_1:
Indication: Extrinsic compression L mainstem from lymphadenopathy.
Procedure: Balloon dilation (31630).
- GA, ETT.
- Proximal LMS stenosis 63%.
- Hurricane balloon: 6, 8, 9mm x 45s.
- Post: 35% residual.
- No bleeding.
Plan: Admit overnight. Decadron 10mg.
7725151_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Palliative bronchoscopic dilation for malignant extrinsic compression.
PATIENT: 78-year-old female with metastatic lung adenocarcinoma.
FINDINGS: Extrinsic compression of the proximal left mainstem bronchus due to mediastinal lymphadenopathy, resulting in 63% luminal narrowing. Complex mucosal changes noted.
INTERVENTION: Hurricane balloon dilation was performed at 6mm, 8mm, and 9mm to alleviate obstruction.
OUTCOME: Improvement in luminal patency to approximately 65%. No complications.
7725151_syn_3:
Code: 31630.
Indication: Bronchial stenosis (extrinsic).
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with dilation. L mainstem bronchus dilated using Hurricane balloon (6-9mm). Improvement from 63% to 65% patency documented. Palliative intent.
7725151_syn_4:
Resident Note
Patient: [REDACTED]
Procedure: Airway Dilation
Staff: Dr. J. Williams
Steps:
1. GA, ETT 8.0.
2. Scope to LMS.
3. Extrinsic compression found.
4. Hurricane balloon dilation x 3.
5. Modest improvement.
Plan: Admit overnight.
7725151_syn_5: susan jackson has lung cancer and nodes pushing on her airway. left main is tight 63 percent. put her to sleep. used the hurricane balloon 6 8 9 mm. helped a bit opened to maybe 65 percent. no bleeding. keep her overnight for observation.
7725151_syn_6: This 78-year-old female with metastatic lung cancer underwent bronchoscopy for extrinsic bronchial compression. Under general anesthesia, the left mainstem bronchus was found to be narrowed by 63% due to lymphadenopathy. A Hurricane balloon was used for dilation at 6mm, 8mm, and 9mm. The airway patency improved to 65%. There were no complications. The patient was admitted for overnight observation.
7725151_syn_7:
[Indication]
Extrinsic bronchial compression from mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
[Anesthesia]
General, ETT.
[Description]
L mainstem stenosis (63%) id[REDACTED]. Hurricane balloon dilation performed (6-9mm). Patency improved to 65%.
[Plan]
Admit overnight. Repeat in 6 weeks.
7725151_syn_8: [REDACTED] a palliative dilation for her airway compression. After induction, we visualized the left mainstem bronchus which was compressed by lymph nodes. We used a Hurricane balloon to gently dilate the area. We saw some improvement in the airway caliber. She tolerated the procedure well and was admitted for monitoring.
7725151_syn_9:
PROBLEM: Airway squashing from cancer nodes.
ACTION: Scope with balloon stretching.
FINDINGS: The left main air tube was pinched shut by about 63%. We used a Hurricane balloon to push it open. We went up to 9mm. The opening improved slightly. No bleeding occurred. She will stay in the hospital tonight.
